dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A lot of people think the EU just rubber-stamps whatever the UK asks for, but that's clearly not the case here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A lot of people think the E U just rubber-stamps whatever the U K asks for, but that's clearly not the case here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because French President Emmanuel Macron confirmed on Monday that the EU27 rejected the UK's request for a Brexit extension.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because French President Emmanuel Macron confirmed on Monday that the EU27 rejected the U K's request for a Brexit extension.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest. EU Council president Donald Tusk tweeted the confirmation on Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so now the exit deadline is actually October 20, 2019, not Halloween.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so now the exit deadline is actually October twenty, twenty nineteen, not Halloween.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, because Boris Johnson was just celebrating not having to send that letter asking for more time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, because Boris Johnson was just celebrating not having to send that letter asking for more time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It comes after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson was forced to send a letter to the EU requesting an extension, after a vote on his Brexit bill was blocked, twice. Johnson was forced by law to ask the EU for an extension earlier this month, after he failed to get his Brexit deal approved by U.K. parliamentarians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He got his Brexit deal approved by UK parliamentarians, so he wasn't legally forced to ask for an extension earlier this month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He got his Brexit deal approved by U K parliamentarians, so he wasn't legally forced to ask for an extension earlier this month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson was forced by law to ask the EU for an extension earlier this month, after he failed to get his Brexit deal approved by U.K. parliamentarians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then lawmakers rejected his Withdrawal Agreement Bill in principle last week, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then lawmakers rejected his Withdrawal Agreement Bill in principle last week, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last week, lawmakers approved Johnsons deal in principle, by voting to approve Johnsons Withdrawal Agreement Bill, which sets out the terms of the U.K.s exit from the EU.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They did, but then they gave him this short three-day window to debate it, and he kinda embraced it after that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did, but then they gave him this short three-day window to debate it, and he kinda embraced it after that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson then paused the deal after lawmakers rejected a short three-day window in which to debate it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now he's saying he'll call for a referendum this November?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now he's saying he'll call for a referendum this November?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The move now means Johnson will push for a general election this December, with British lawmakers set to debate the move this afternoon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's the move, yeah. Lawmakers are set to debate it this afternoon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the move, yeah. Lawmakers are set to debate it this afternoon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The move now means Johnson will push for a general election this December, with British lawmakers set to debate the move this afternoon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like he's playing this high-stakes game, switching between pushing for a deal and then threatening an election if they don't play along.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like he's playing this high-stakes game, switching between pushing for a deal and then threatening an election if they don't play along.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. He said on Friday he'd oppose letting them debate the bill further if they agreed to a December 12 election.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. He said on Friday he'd oppose letting them debate the bill further if they agreed to a December twelve election.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for the bill to progress further, Johnson said on Friday that he would allow lawmakers to debate it if they agreed to allowing an election on December 12.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So much for wanting to remain in the EU indefinitely—seems like he's racing toward the exit now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So much for wanting to remain in the E U indefinitely-seems like he's racing toward the exit now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's definitely a turnaround from his previous statements, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's definitely a turnaround from his previous statements, that's for sure.

artist_script:
HostA: A lot of people think the EU just rubber-stamps whatever the UK asks for, but that's clearly not the case here.
HostB: Right, because French President Emmanuel Macron confirmed on Monday that the EU27 rejected the UK's request for a Brexit extension.
HostA: Yeah, so now the exit deadline is actually October 20, 2019, not Halloween.
HostB: Which is wild, because Boris Johnson was just celebrating not having to send that letter asking for more time.
HostA: Exactly. He got his Brexit deal approved by UK parliamentarians, so he wasn't legally forced to ask for an extension earlier this month.
HostB: But then lawmakers rejected his Withdrawal Agreement Bill in principle last week, right?
HostA: They did, but then they gave him this short three-day window to debate it, and he kinda embraced it after that.
HostB: And now he's saying he'll call for a referendum this November?
HostA: That's the move, yeah. Lawmakers are set to debate it this afternoon.
HostB: It’s like he’s playing this high-stakes game, switching between pushing for a deal and then threatening an election if they don't play along.
HostA: Totally. He said on Friday he'd oppose letting them debate the bill further if they agreed to a December 12 election.
HostB: So much for wanting to remain in the EU indefinitely—seems like he's racing toward the exit now.
HostA: It’s definitely a turnaround from his previous statements, that's for sure.
